simj

Class SimEntityFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • simj.SimEntityFactory
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClientFactory

    public class SimEntityFactory
extends Object
    This singleton class implements an entity factory.
    Author:
    Patrik Fuhrer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected SimEntityFactory()
      Protected constructor to avoid external instantiation of this singleton class.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SimEntity createSimEntity()
      Creates a new entity with an unique ID.
      protected SimEntity doCreateSimEntity(int pId)
      Creates a new entity with the given unique ID.
      static SimEntityFactory getUniqueInstance()
      Returns the unique instance of this singleton class.
      void reset()
      Resets the entity factory.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimEntityFactory

        protected SimEntityFactory()
        Protected constructor to avoid external instantiation of this singleton class.

    • Method Detail

      • createSimEntity

        public SimEntity createSimEntity()
        Creates a new entity with an unique ID. This is a template method.
        Returns:
        A new entity with an unique ID.

      • doCreateSimEntity

        protected SimEntity doCreateSimEntity(int pId)
        Creates a new entity with the given unique ID. This is a factory method, and may be overridden by subclasses. For instance to create more specific entities.
        Parameters:
        pId - The unique ID of the entity that will be created.
        Returns:
        The new entity.

      • getUniqueInstance

        public static SimEntityFactory getUniqueInstance()
        Returns the unique instance of this singleton class.
        Returns:
        The unique instance of this singleton class.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the entity factory. To be specific, the next generated entity will have ID = 1. This method must be invoked only before the beginning of a simulation. Indeed, one must be sure that the ID of an entity is unique in a simulation.
